text: I have kind of a broad question about testing. I have been tasked with drafting a test plan for my current sprint/build.  I am a Junior tester (first job, yay!) and barely know the test software (SoapUI) and have a basic understanding of the software to be tested. I’m working on some government middleware (Its not android but I don’t know where else to ask this.) How am I supposed to proceed? I’ve asked for a template or to see previous test plans but no one either has them or knows where to find them. I feel so lost and I don’t know what they are expecting me to come back with.
Is there a generally accepted template? I was always under the assumption that a Lead would provide the test plan to the rookies.
It’s %100 remote and I’ve tried to be the squeeky wheel but I’m worried about over doing it since I’m brand new

I think the general process is to read the specs and then find out what you need to test. Talk to the devs a lot, that's what I tell our QA people. We can generally give you good hints of possible spots that need more manual testing if we don't cover them by automated tests. We also define a set of regression tests that will be run against every version. SoapUI is can be pretty complex if you want it to be but lets you automate pretty easily once you get a hang of it.

I appreciate the input. I just really wish everyone was in the same building. It’s much easier face to face. I know I could get a decent explanation in 5 minutes and have them see that I get it and I’m learning. It’s hard to show that I’m trying my best over the phone and through emails
